original_title: Coconut Cultivation Board urges caution against consuming coconuts affected by Brontispa
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The Coconut Cultivation Board advises the public to avoid consuming coconuts until two months after the Brontispa insect-infested coconut trees have been treated.

The board's chairwoman, Madhavi Herath, says that vaccination efforts are underway to combat the insect menace spreading in Galle district's coconut plantations. As of now, 13,481 diseased coconut trees have been identified in this regard.
Cabinet approval given for agreement to further develop Trincomalee – Ali Sabry
